answers.answer: Hi there.From what you have described, it seems to to me that this is really a complex situation and indeed very hard to ascertain the cause.  Her symptoms may point out to a primary eye problem, like a tortuous blood vessel underneath the retina.  This may be unlikely due to the previous bleeding.  This is most commonly seen in patients with vascular or metabolic problems such as hypertension or diabetes.  I suggest that she be assessed by an ophthalmologist to see if there are abnormal blood vessels.  If so, these can be treated with laser or local surgery.  Regards and God bless.
